intro: Dendrocnide crenulata, commonly known as the serrated stinging tree, is a shrub native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its stinging hairs contain irritants that can cause severe skin reactions in humans. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
